title: Safe Sleep Basics
summary: Always place your baby on their back to sleep, for naps and at night.
details: Use a firm sleep surface covered by a fitted sheet. Keep soft bedding, crib bumpers, and toys out of the crib to reduce the risk of SIDS. Room sharing is recommended for the first 6 months.

title: The Power of Skin-to-Skin
summary: Holding your baby skin-to-skin helps regulate their body temperature and heart rate.
details: Skin-to-skin contact, also known as Kangaroo Care, boosts oxytocin levels in both parent and baby, promoting bonding and reducing stress. It's beneficial for both moms and dads to practice.

title: Feeding on Demand
summary: Watch your baby, not the clock. Feed them whenever they show hunger cues.
details: Early hunger cues include smacking lips, sucking on hands, and rooting. Crying is a late sign of hunger. Feeding on demand helps establish a good milk supply for breastfeeding moms and ensures baby gets enough to eat.
